member.name: P:C1.Silverlight.Schedule.C1Calendar.GenerateAdjacentMonthDays
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines whether to show days corresponding to months which are adjacent for the months currently represented by the control. The default value is False. This is a dependency property.

remarks.para: If is set to true, the property for the showing a first of currently represented months and the property for the showing a last of currently represented months are set to true.

member.name: P:C1.Silverlight.Schedule.C1Calendar.MonthCount
member.summary: Gets or sets a number of months currently represented by the calendar. The default value is 1. This is a dependency property.

remarks.para: A default UI of the control is designed so as to fit as many child controls as can fit in the current control size, taking into account the size of each single month calendar which is determined by the and properties. As a result, when control is resized, a value of the property is changed automatically.
You can change default behavior by using custom ItemsPanelTemplate. For more details see property description.

member.name: P:C1.Silverlight.Schedule.C1Calendar.MonthsPanel
member.summary: Gets or sets an ItemsPanelTemplate that defines the panel that lays out elements representing separate months. This is a dependency property.

remarks.para:
C1Calendar controls supports the next panels:
The panel. This is a default setting. A value of the property is set automatically according to the available space.
The panel. A value of the property is set automatically according to the grid definition.
The panel. The control honors explicitely defined property value.
The panel. The control honors explicitely defined property value.
<c1sched:C1Calendar MonthCount="4"> <c1sched:C1Calendar.MonthsPanel> <ItemsPanelTemplate> <StackPanel Orientation="Horizontal"/> </ItemsPanelTemplate> </c1sched:C1Calendar.MonthsPanel> </c1sched:C1Calendar>

member.name: P:C1.Silverlight.Schedule.C1CalendarItem.DaySlots
member.summary: Gets a collection of elements defining a data based on which a control UI representing month days is created.
member.remarks:
The collection items ( objects) for this collection are automatically generated based on the and property values. These items are used as a basis for a creation of UI that represents days of month. For each object in this collection, the calendar creates a UI elements tree according to DataTemplate defined in the property and sets up the as a DataContext for the elements in the tree. The root elements of those trees are laid out by a panel defined in the property.
The number of elements in the collection 7 * 6 = 42, where 7 is a number of days in a week and 6 is a maximum number of week lines in a calendar with a rectangular layout necessary to fit all the days.
The first in the collection corresponds to a first day of a week that includes a first day of a currently represented month. The DaySlots that don't correspond to a day in the currently represented month can be empty ( is true) or represent a day from an adjacent month, which depends on the and property values.

member.summary: Represents a day slot in the control.
member.remarks: An instance of this class can represent a day of a month or an empty slot, which is determined by the property value. In the case when is empty, the property will have a null value, but the other properties will still contain information that allows you to determine the placement of the slot in the calendar. For example the property will determine a day of week that the slot corresponds to.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value determining whether control should show button for external editing or ComboBox for the single selection.

remarks.para: If this property is true, control shows Button and TextBox. In such case editing and selection from the source collection should be implemented by the caller, when event is fired.
If this property is false, controls shows ComboBox for the single selection. In this case, TargetCollection is updated automatically when user selects ComboBox item.

member.name: T:C1.Silverlight.Schedule.AppointmentWrapPanel
member.summary: Positions child elements in sequential position from left to right, breaking content to the next line at the edge of the containing box. Subsequent ordering happens sequentially from top to bottom or from right to left, depending on the value of the property. If property is this panel behaves as the base class. If property is then tries to position child elements in available space. For example, it doesn't wrap the child to the next line if the next line invisible. Instead, it shows as much as possible in the last visible line.

member.name: T:C1.Silverlight.Schedule.AppointmentsCoverPane
member.summary: Provides a surface for painting appointment boxes over an arbitrary visual intervals layout.
member.remarks:
allows you to visually represent a set of appointments that fit in a time range exposed by a current view, and to draw appointment boxes relative to UI elements representing s covered by the appointment. The element, being placed somewhere inside visual tree (usually in C1Scheduler's ControlTemplate), provides a surface where it draws appointment boxes relative to UI elements representing VisualIntervals. AppointmentsCoverPane is capable to recognize the case when the appointment box must be divided into two or more visual boxes, for example, if appointment covers three days in the Working Week View, AppointmentsCoverPane will automatically draw three boxes for the appointment, each box in a corresponding day column, with starting and ending edges positioned at interval UI elements corresponding to start and end time of the appointment in this day.
AppointmentsCoverPane provides this functionality for an arbitrary UI representing s. To make it possible, each element that can be treated as VisualInterval UI representative (usually it's an outer (root) element in the definition) must have the attached assigned ( is the base class for ). The assigned value indicates a chronological flow direction of interval elements and can take Horizontal or Vertical values. For example, interval elements in the Working Week View have it assigned to Vertical, while elements of Month View assign it to Horizontal. A content of an appointment box of AppointmentsCoverPane is represented by DataTemplate defined in the property.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value, determining height of the cover elements. This property makes sense for horizontal orientation only. The default value is 27. If is false, and is NaN, every cover element will have height equal to covered element height reduced by the value of property. The height will be changed automatically at resizing of underlying UI.

member.name: F:C1.Silverlight.Schedule.AppointmentsCoverPane.KeepTimesAtDropProperty
member.summary: The KeepTimesAtDrop attached property determines the behavior of moved (dragged) appointments. If this value is True, after dragging an appointment to the desired VisualInterval, the Appointment start date is changed to the VisualInterval start date. If this value is False, the Appointment.Start becomes equal to the VisualInterval.StartTime, and Appointment.Duration becomes equal to the VisualInterval.TimeScale. The default value is False.

For example, in the Months view the appointment that hit two weeks will be represented by two separate elements, a different element for each week. member.remarks: Each object derived from is identified by either Id or Index property. To allow data to be correctly restored from your data sources you should specify mapping either for the or for the . It makes sense in case if you bind to your data storages of Resources, Labels, Contacts or Categories. C1Schedule saves only Ids or Indexes of these objects in AppointmentSorage. If there is no mapping for IdMapping or IndexMapping, C1Schedule won't be able to identify Appointment's properties correctly in storages initialized by your data.

member.name: T:C1.C1Schedule.BaseStorage`2
member.summary: The is the base generic component for all storages in C1Schedule object model. Represents a storage of objects derived from . This component implements methods of operations over the collections of objects. It allows the collection to be populated programmatically or automatically by retrieving data from the data source which is specified by the DataSource and DataMember properties. It allows mapping of data source fields to the object properties.

member.summary: Gets an array of objects representing the key of the .

remarks.para: In the current version, the array always contains a single object. It can be either an or value depending on which one is actually used for binding this data. For example, if you bind AppointmentStorage to the database and set IndexMapping, this property will return an value. If you set IdMapping, this property will return a value.

member.name: M:C1.C1Schedule.Appointment.BeginEdit
member.summary: Prevents the object from being updated until the method is called.
member.remarks: The and methods are designed to implement batch modifications. This allows you to prevent generation of change notifications when changing multiple settings at the same time. To do this enclose the code that changes the properties in calls to these methods. Each call to must be paired with a call to . To ensure that is always called even if an exception occurs, wrap any calls to these methods in a try...finally statement.

member.summary: Gets an object for the object. Once this property is first requested, a new object is created and assigned to the property.
member.remarks: The object contains information regarding the type of action to perform as well as the command and parameters to pass to the action. If the action object is enabled, the action will be invoked when the start date and time of the owning object has occurred.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.Appointment.Conflicts
member.summary: Gets the object representing the list of objects which are in conflict with this particular appointment.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.Appointment.AutoResolvedWinner
member.summary: Gets the value determining if the item is a winner of an automatic conflict resolution.
member.remarks: A value of false does not necessarily indicate that the item is a loser of an automatic conflict resolution. The item should be in conflict with another item. If an item has its Conflicts.Count property greater than zero and if its property is true, it is a winner of an automatic conflict resolution. On the other hand, if the item is in conflict and has its property as false, it is a loser in an automatic conflict resolution.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.Appointment.Start
member.summary: Gets or sets the value determining the start date and time of the appointment.

remarks.para: If the property is set to true, then the start date of the appointment is the of the , and the start time of the appointment is 0:00.
At setting this property, if it's time is not equal 0:00, the property will be set to false.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.Appointment.End
member.summary: Gets or sets the value determining the end date and time of the appointment.

remarks.para: The property is usually specified by the and properties, and is always calculated as = + . When setting the property, the property retains its value, and the is changed according to the new value of the property. If the new property's value is less than the property's value, then an exception will be raised.
At setting this property, if it's time is not equal 0:00, or value is equal to the value of property, the property will be set to false.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.Appointment.Duration
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating the duration of the appointment.
member.remarks: At setting this property, if it's value is not equal to the whole number of days, the property will be set to false.

member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating if the associated object has non-default settings. True if the reminder overrides the default reminder behavior for the appointment. You must set the property to validate the and the properties.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.Appointment.ReminderPlaySound
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating if the reminder should play a sound when it occurs for this appointment or task. The property must be set in order to validate the property. This property is only valid if the property is set to true.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.Appointment.ReminderSoundFile
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating the path and file name of the sound file to play when the reminder occurs for the appointment. This property is only valid if the and properties are set to true.
member.remarks: The default sound is .

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.Appointment.IsRecurring
member.summary: Gets the value indicating if the appointment is recurring.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.Appointment.ParentRecurrence
member.summary: Gets the object that defines the recurrence criteria for this object. If this appointment is a not member of a recurrence, or is itself a root appointment, null is returned.
member.remarks: If an appointment is recurring (see the property) it represents an occurrence in the series that is started and defined by a specific pattern appointment. Use the property to obtain the pattern of the current appointment. A pattern appointment can be recognized by its property set to the value. The recurrence information defined by the pattern appointment can be accessed via the property of the appointment.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.Appointment.RecurrenceState
member.summary: Gets the value indicating the recurrence state of the appointment.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.Appointment.Tag
member.summary: Gets or sets custom information associated with this object.
member.remarks: This property is valid only for the lifetime of the object.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.Appointment.CustomData
member.summary: Gets or sets custom text associated with this object.
member.remarks: This property is serialized with other appointment properties. It isn't used by the scheduler, use it to keep your data associated with appointment. This property is serialized into xml and binary formats and it is saved into underlying data source if mapping for Appointment Properties is set. It isn't retained at export/import to iCal format.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.RecurrencePattern.Interval
member.summary: Gets or sets the value specifying the interval between occurrences of the recurrence. The property works in conjunction with the property to determine the cycle of the recurrence. The maximum allowable value is 99 for weekly patterns and 999 for daily patterns. The default value is 1.
member.remarks: For example, if the is set to , and the is set to 3, the recurrence will occur every third day.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.RecurrencePattern.EndTime
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating the end time for the given occurrence of the recurrence pattern.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.RecurrencePattern.StartTime
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating the start time for the given occurrence of the recurrence pattern.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.RecurrencePattern.Duration
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating the duration of each occurrence in the recurrence pattern.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.RecurrencePattern.PatternStartDate
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating the start date of the recurrence pattern.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.RecurrencePattern.PatternEndDate
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating the end date of the recurrence pattern.
member.remarks: This property is optional but must be coordinated with other properties when setting up a recurrence pattern. If this property or the property is set, the pattern is considered to be finite, and the property is false. If neither nor is set, the pattern is considered infinite and is true. The property must be set before setting .

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.RecurrencePattern.Occurrences
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of occurrences for the recurrence pattern. This property allows the definition of a recurrence pattern that is only valid for the specified number of subsequent occurrences. For example, you can set this property to 10 for a formal training course that will be held on the next ten Thursday evenings. The default value is 0.
member.remarks: This property must be coordinated with other properties when setting up a recurrence pattern. If the property or the property is set, the pattern is considered to be finite and the property is false. If neither nor is set, the pattern is considered infinite and is true.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.RecurrencePattern.Instance
member.summary: Get or sets the value specifying the count for which the recurrence pattern is valid for a given interval. This property is only valid for recurrences of the and types and allows the definition of a recurrence pattern that is only valid for the Nth occurrence, such as "the 2nd Sunday in March" pattern. The default value is WeekOfMonthEnum.First.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.RecurrencePattern.DayOfWeekMask
member.summary: Gets or sets the value representing the mask for week days on which the recurring appointment occurs. Monthly and yearly patterns are only valid for a single day. Weekly patterns are only valid as the Or of the . The default value is 0.
member.remarks: When the property is set to , the property can only be set to ; setting the property to any other value will result in an exception. When the property is set to , the property can only be set to ; setting the property to any other value will result in an exception. When the property is set to , the property cannot be set to ; doing so will result in an exception being thrown. When the property is set to or the property is not applicable.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.RecurrencePattern.DayOfMonth
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of the day in its respective month on which each occurrence will occur. Applicable only when the property is set to or . The default value is 1.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.RecurrencePattern.MonthOfYear
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating which month of the year is valid for the specified recurrence pattern. Can be a number from 1 to 12. This property is only valid for recurrence patterns whose property is set to or . The default value is 1.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.RecurrencePattern.NoEndDate
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating if the recurrence pattern is endless. The default value is True.
member.remarks: This property must be coordinated with other properties when setting up a recurrence pattern. If the property or the property is set, the pattern is considered to be finite and the property is false. If neither nor is set, the pattern is considered infinite and is true.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.RecurrencePattern.Exceptions
member.summary: Gets the object which holds the list of objects that define the exceptions to that series of appointments. objects are added to the whenever a property in the corresponding object is altered.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.RecurrencePattern.RemovedOccurrences
member.summary: Gets the object which holds the list of objects removed from that series of appointments.

member.summary: Occurs when a object has been removed from the collection.
member.remarks: A reminder can be removed from the Reminders collection by any of the following means: - The Reminders collection's Remove method. - The Reminder object's Dismiss method. - When the user clicks the Dismiss button. - When a user turns off a meeting reminder from within the associated item. - When a user deletes an item that contains a reminder.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value specifying DateTime kind used for saving values.
member.remarks: This property only has an influence on the process of saving data to the AppointmentStorage.DataSource object and on export operations. All properties of the and objects represent current system local time values. Set this property to DateTimeLind.Utc if you need to save data with universal time. member.name: T:C1.Silverlight.Schedule.SelectedEnumMemberConverter
member.summary: Represents a Binding converter that indicates whether a binding source value is an enum member specified in the converter parameter.
member.remarks:
is a two-way converter.
Source - Target behavior:
If a binding source value is an enum member specified in a converter parameter, then the binding target value is True; otherwise, False.
Target - Source behavior:
If target is True, then the source is the enum member specified in a parameter. Otherwise, the source is not updated.

member.summary: Represents a Binding converter that indicates whether a binding source value contains an enum member (flag) specified in the converter parameter.
member.remarks:
Source - Target behavior:
If source value is an enum member and it contains a flag specified in a converter parameter, then the target is True; otherwise, False.
Target - Source behavior:

member.name: T:C1.Silverlight.Schedule.EnsureEnumMemberConverter
member.summary: Represents a Binding converter that indicates whether a binding source value is one of enum members specified in the converter parameter.
member.remarks:
is a two-way converter. A converter parameter should be a string representing a list of enum member names separated by the ';' or ',' character.
Source - Target behavior:
Returns True if a source value is one of the enum members listed in a parameter; otherwise, False.
Target - Source behavior:
If target is True, then returns a first enum member (as enum, not as a string name) from members listed in a converter parameter.

member.name: M:C1.Silverlight.Schedule.C1Scheduler.SetRelativeStartTime(System.Double)
member.summary: Sets the property to a value between the and property values based on the specified coefficient.
member.param: A double value in a range between 0 and 1 that defines a relative value between and .
member.remarks:
The approximate new value is calculated with the following formula:
VisualStartTime = Start + (End - Start) * coefficient
After the new value is calculated, it is adjusted so that the old and new values of the property become different in an amount that is multiple of the property value, that guarantees that the first in the collection is properly aligned to be in synch with UI model suppositions.
This method implements the command.

member.summary: Gets or sets a start of a period of time that is currently represented in the control UI. This is a dependency property.
member.remarks:
Usually this property value should not be set directly; it gets its value automatically based on the and properties (the latter one has DateTime.Today as default) so as to be aligned at the beginning of a current week or current month's first week. Setting it to a value that is not correctly aligned relative to the current control UI (for example, if it is not set to the first day of the week for the Month view) can cause an inadequate UI look.
To change a current period of time safely you can use the property or the method or the command.

member.name: E:C1.Silverlight.Schedule.C1Scheduler.DataSourceItemSynchronized
member.summary: Occurs when changes made to one of the collections (for example, to ) has been fully reflected in the storage underlying data source.
member.remarks:
If properties of an item of the collection are changed between BeginEdit and EndEdit calls performed on the item, this event will not be raised until the EndEdit method will be called.
Use this event if you want to update a back store of your data source only after the changes to a corresponding collection have been fully completed. For example, if you use ADO.NET DataSet as a data source, you can commit the changes made in a DataRow as a result of changes in the collection item to the underlying database.

member.name: E:C1.Silverlight.Schedule.C1Scheduler.UserEditingAppointment
member.summary: Occurs before the Edit Appointment dialog appears on the screen for editing of an existing appointment, as a result of a double-click on the appointment in one of the default control views, the method call, or when an command is received.
member.remarks:
Use this event to make custom settings to an editing appointment before it appears on the screen and/or to implement your own reaction on this event, instead of activating a standard dialog window.
In order to change appointment properties before showing the dialog on a screen, use the appointment object referenced by the e.Appointment event argument.
To prevent activating a standard dialog window, set the e.Handled event argument to True.

member.name: E:C1.Silverlight.Schedule.C1Scheduler.UserAddingAppointment
member.summary:
Occurs before the Edit Appointment dialog appears on the screen as a result of:
a double-click on the control area in one of the default control views,
the NewAppointmentDialog method call,
a command.
member.remarks:
Use this event to make custom settings to a new appointment before it appears on the screen and/or to implement your own reaction on this event, instead of activating a standard dialog window.
In order to change appointment properties before showing the dialog on a screen, use the appointment object referenced by the e.Appointment event argument.
To prevent activating a standard dialog window, set the e.Handled event argument to True.

member.name: T:C1.Silverlight.Schedule.TimeSlotGroupStyleSelector
member.summary: This class provides a way to apply time slot group styles for working/free hours in DayView/WorkWeekView modes.
member.remarks:
For the sample of using look at OneDayStyleBase in generic.xaml.
Create an instance of this class:
<local:TimeSlotGroupStyleSelector x:Key="TimeSlotGroupStyleSelector"/>
Define two group styles:
with the key "PART_C1Scheduler_WorkHour_Style" for work hours;
with the key "PART_C1Scheduler_FreeHour_Style" for free hours.
Specify style selector in the group definition:
<GroupStyle ContainerStyleSelector="{StaticResource TimeSlotGroupStyleSelector}">

member.name: M:C1.Silverlight.Schedule.TimeSlotGroupStyleSelector.SelectStyle(System.Object,System.Windows.DependencyObject)
member.summary: Returns the object for the specified group if it is found in resources.
member.param: The content.
The element to which the style will be applied.
member.returns: Returns an application-specific style to apply; otherwise, a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).

member.name: T:C1.Silverlight.Schedule.DayGroupStyleSelector
member.summary: This class provides a way to apply day group styles in DayView/WorkWeekView modes.
member.remarks:
For the sample of using look at OneDayStyle in themes/SchedulerThemes/Office2007/Blue.xaml.
Create an instance of this class:
<local:DayGroupStyleSelector x:Key="DayGroupStyleSelector"/>
Define two group styles:
with the key "PART_C1Scheduler_Day_Style" for ordinal day style;
with the key "PART_C1Scheduler_Today_Style" for the current day style.
Specify style selector in the group definition:
<GroupStyle ContainerStyleSelector="{StaticResource DayGroupStyleSelector}"/>

member.name: M:C1.Silverlight.Schedule.DayGroupStyleSelector.SelectStyle(System.Object,System.Windows.DependencyObject)
member.summary: Returns the object for the specified group if it is found in resources.
member.param: The content.
The element to which the style will be applied.
member.returns: Returns an application-specific style to apply; otherwise, a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).

member.name: T:C1.Silverlight.Schedule.TimeSlotTemplateSelector
member.summary: This class provides a way to choose a DataTemplate for the object representing the single time slot in DayView/WorkWeekView modes.
member.remarks:
For the sample of using look at OneDayStyleBase in generic.xaml.
Create an instance of this class:
<local:TimeSlotTemplateSelector x:Key="TimeSlotTemplateSelector"/>
Define two DataTemplates:
with the key "PART_C1Scheduler_FreeSlot_Template" for free time;
with the key "PART_C1Scheduler_WorkSlot_Template" for working time.
Specify for the object:
<local:C1SchedulerPresenter ItemTemplateSelector="{StaticResource TimeSlotTemplateSelector}" />
Note, that if you use this method for choosing VisualInterval DataTemplate, you shouldn't set property.

member.name: M:C1.Silverlight.Schedule.TimeSlotTemplateSelector.SelectTemplate(System.Object,System.Windows.DependencyObject)
member.summary: Returns the object for the specified group if it is found in resources.
member.param: The data object for which to select the template.
The data-bound object.
member.returns: Returns a DataTemplate or a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic). The default value is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).

member.name: T:C1.Silverlight.Schedule.DayIntervalStyleSelector
member.summary: This class provides a way to apply day group styles for ordinal/current days.
member.remarks:
For the sample of using look at OneDayStyleBase in generic.xaml.
Create an instance of this class:
<local:DayIntervalStyleSelector x:Key="DayIntervalStyleSelector"/>
Define two group styles:
with the key "C1Scheduler_Day_Style" for ordinal days;
with the key "C1Scheduler_Today_Style" for the current day.
Specify style selector in the group definition:
<GroupStyle ContainerStyleSelector="{StaticResource DayIntervalStyleSelector}">

member.name: T:C1.Silverlight.Schedule.TimeSlotStyleSelector
member.summary: This class provides a way to apply time slot styles for working/free hours in DayView/WorkWeekView modes.
member.remarks:
For the sample of using look at OneDayStyle in generic.xaml.
Create an instance of this class:
<local:TimeSlotStyleSelector x:Key="TimeSlotStyleSelector"/>
Define two group styles:
with the key "PART_C1Scheduler_WorkHour_Style" for work hours;
with the key "PART_C1Scheduler_FreeHour_Style" for free hours.
Specify ItemContainerStyleSelector property for the object:
<local:C1SchedulerPresenter ItemContainerStyleSelector="{StaticResource TimeSlotTemplateSelector}" />
